statement.p: Solve ~3x^{1.05} = 18~. Round your answer to hundredths.

solution.p: This is a power equation. We divide both sides by 3 to isolate the variable, then raise both sides to the reciprocal of the exponent. \begin{aligned}[t] (x^{1.05})^{1/1.05} \amp = 6^{1/1.05}\\ x \amp = 5.51 \end{aligned}

statement.p: Solve ~3(1.05)^x = 18~. Round your answer to hundredths.

solution.p: This is an exponential equation. We divide both sides by 3, then take logarithms. \begin{aligned}[t] \log(1.05^x) \amp = \log 6 \amp\amp \blert{\text{Apply the third log property.}}\\ x \log 1.05\amp = \log 6\\ x \amp \dfrac{\log 6}{\log 1.05} = 36.72 \end{aligned}

statement.p: Solve ~9x^{3/5} = 36~. Round your answer to hundredths.

solution.p: This is a power equation. We divide both sides by 9 to isolate the variable, then raise both sides to the reciprocal of the exponent. \begin{aligned}[t] (x^{3/5}^{5/3} \amp = 4^{5/3}\\ x \amp = 10.08 \end{aligned}

statement.p: Solve ~1.5(3^{x/5}) = 12~. Round your answer to hundredths.

solution.p: This is an exponential equation. We divide both sides by 1.5, then take logarithms. \begin{aligned}[t] \log 3^{x/5} \amp = \log 8 \amp\amp \blert{\text{Apply the third log property.}}\\ \dfrac{x}{5} \log 3 \amp = \log 8\\ x \amp \dfrac{5\log 8}{\log 3} = 9.46 \end{aligned}

The half-life of a cold medication in the body is 6 hours. Find its decay rate.

solution.p: The decay law for the medication is N=N_0(0.5)^{t/8}. We can rewrite this expression as N=N_0(0.5^{1/8})^t, so b=0.5^{1/8}=0.9170, and r=1-b=0.083. The decay rate is 8.3%.

statement.p: The growth rate of a population of badgers is 3.8% per year. Find its doubling time.

solution.p: The growth law for the population is P=P_0(1.038)^t. We set P=2P_0 and solve for t. \begin{aligned}[t] 2P_0 \amp = P_0(1.038)^t \amp\amp \blert{\text{Divide both sides by}~P_0.}\\ 2 \amp = (1.038)^t \amp\amp \blert{\text{Take the log of both sides.}}\\ \log 2 \amp = t \log 1.038 \amp\amp \blert{\text{Apply the third log property.}}\\ t \amp = \dfrac{\log 2}{\log 1.038} = 18.59 \end{aligned} The doubling time is 18.59 years.

solution.p: The initial value is given by the vertical intercept of the graph, (0,600), so N_0 = 600.
When t=5,~N=300, so the half-life of the substance is 5 hours. Thus the decay law is N(t)=600(0.5)^{t/5}, or N(t)=600(0.87)^t.
